"Whoa, there! Watch your step. The stones are a might slippery." 

The pirate stumbles when he turns, slapping a palm onto the table to steady himself. In the process, he knocks a tankard to the ground, spilling a frothy beverage.
"Come for a drink with us?"
"Shush, you rumpots! Or Cragheart'll be down here again."
"Got to keep it down, she says. Rot her tongue, I says."
"Twenty pires says I can drink you under the table."
"What's got Ungwith the Craghearted all twisted up?"
"Is this a celebratory drink?"
"Farewell."
"You can pay to try. Drink up, and we'll see who's left standing."
"She loathes any type of disorder, especially that of the loud variety. We get too wild, and you watch. She'll be stomping down here to yell at us."
"You bet! Our boatswain just bought a treasure map. We're saluting to our future prosperity, we are."
"Come, we've plenty to share!"
"Going to go through with it this round?"
"First up's a round of Aedyran mead!" One of the more sober pirates pours two pints of the thick, sweet brew.
[Drink the mead.]
"I'd rather not do this now."
You knock back the tankard and take a deep swallow.
"Afraid you'll lose? No skin off of my nose."
Gulp after gulp glides smoothly down your throat until the mug's run dry.
Too muculent, the brew clogs in your throat. You choke, spewing half a mouthful onto the table.
"Not a bad start. Not at all." He nods to you respectfully before guzzling down his own pint.
"Next round's, grog! Not just any grog, mind you. This batch's fermented with gunpowder."
[Drink the grog.]
You raise the tankard, ignoring the black powder swirling up from the bottom as you chug down a heady swig.
The grog burns something fierce on the way down, but you guzzle it all before slamming your empty mug onto the table in triumph.
"Not many can handle a whole pint of gunpowder grog." He lifts his brows, both surprised and impressed. Then he struggles through his own drink before offering you a snide, wet-looking grin.
"Now, the best for last. We'll be having us a bit of Hangman's Blood! If this doesn't knock you on your backside, nothing will, I fear."
[Drink the liquor.]
The drink looks deceptively smooth and beery, but it stinks to the high skies. When you swivel the mug, chunks of rotting fruit bob up to the surface.
Every swallow feels like choking back bile. The drink scours a hole in your belly, and leaves you parched. But you finish the entire pint down to the last drop.
At first, the pirate merely stares. Then he nervously licks his lips and with trembling fingers, reaches for his own pint of the corrosive concoction.

"Flay me for crows' bait should I ever turn craven!"

In a surge of courage, the drunkard gulps down his own pint. His chest heaves as he clinks the cup's bottom, and a cocky grin begins a slow sweep of his lips.
"Let's get swilling."

"Here's to ourselves! May the gods grant us more gold and luck than we can imagine."

He raises his mug high overhead.
"We'd be making a proper raucous if Ungwith the Craghearted wasn't such an accursed downer."
[Pretend to drink from an empty tankard.]
[Pretend to drink from an empty tankard.]

"Don't take it personally, pal. It's a fine way to lose twenty pires!"

Laughing, the drunkard turns to brag to his crewmates - having already forgotten to claim his winnings.
[Pretend to drink from an empty tankard.]
"What's Hangman's Blood made of?"
"It's been known to kill a man. Or at least his breath."

But his smile freezes half-way, caught in a pained twist as he slowly begins to tilt backwards. 

He topples to the ground, out cold.
"Who?"
"One of Benweth's guards. Right up the stairs. She's like a boil I can't get of. No matter how often I lance it."
"You mean the way our crew makes it? A bit of this and a pinch of that, all mixed in a hogshead of pickled corpsefruit."
"Wait, a minute... You mean to say, you don't know Benny's crew...?"
"What are you talking about, you souse?"
"I'm sure I'd recognize her if I saw her."
"Right. What were we talking about? Eh, piss it. Give me another drink."
"I think you ought to meet the Craghearted. Explain to her who exactly you are."
He tries to tap a finger to his chin, instead stumbles and nearly falls.
"Ungwith, get down here! Swiftly now!"
"It's too quiet around here without Ben's parties. Don't think I like it."
"I heard someone got the best of Ben. Had him pissing his trousers."
